001package net.tvburger.jdl.common.utils;
002
003import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.StaticUtility;
004
005/**
006 * Implements utility functions to operate on floats
007 */
008@StaticUtility
009public final class Floats {
010
011    /**
012     * The EPSILON we are using for considering floats equal. (solve problems like: 0,99999999... vs 1,0)
013     */
014    public static final float EPSILON = 1e-6f;
015
016    private Floats() {
017    }
018
019    /**
020     * Returns true if float a and b are closer than EPSILON from each other.
021     *
022     * @param a the float to compare to b
023     * @param b the float to compare to a
024     * @return if the floats are (enough) equal
025     */
026    public static boolean equals(float a, float b) {
027        return Math.abs(a - b) < EPSILON;
028    }
029
030    /**
031     * Returns true if float a and b are not equal (differ)
032     *
033     * @param a the float to compare to b
034     * @param b the float to compare to a
035     * @return true if the floast are different
036     * @see #equals(float, float)
037     */
038    public static boolean notEquals(float a, float b) {
039        return !equals(a, b);
040    }
041
042    /**
043     * Easy way to create float arrays in java
044     *
045     * @param f the floats to put in the array
046     * @return the array
047     */
048    public static float[] of(float... f) {
049        return f;
050    }
051
052    /**
053     * Returns true if f1 is greater than f2
054     *
055     * @param f1 the float to compare to f2
056     * @param f2 the float to compare to f1
057     * @return if f1 greater than f2
058     * @see #notEquals(float, float)
059     */
060    public static boolean greaterThan(float f1, float f2) {
061        return f1 > f2 && notEquals(f1, f2);
062    }
063
064    /**
065     * Converts an array of floats to a boolean array. True if the float is positive
066     *
067     * @param floats the floats to convert
068     * @return the corresponding booleans
069     */
070    public static boolean[] toBooleans(float[] floats) {
071        boolean[] booleans = new boolean[floats.length];
072        for (int i = 0; i < floats.length; i++) {
073            booleans[i] = floats[i] > 0.0f;
074        }
075        return booleans;
076    }
077}
